On May 9, 2007, at 1:02 AM, Julian Reschke wrote:
>> I think that Roy refers to properties not being resources in the  
>> WebDAV model
>> but that they are accessed and manipulated via PROPxxx.
>
> That's true, but applies to WebDAV in general, not RFC3253  
> (Versioning) or RFC3744 (ACL). Introducing WebDAV properties as  
> second-class citizens may have been a bad idea, but that happened  
> long before.

Yes, but that is what the thread was about -- the gates were opened
and the negative effects are multiplied by each new extension
(as opposed to the resource only model, wherein the complexity
of each new extension is linear).

....Roy
